definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Welcome to Hema News. The lastest and finest Chinese News.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎来到河马新闻，最热门最严肃的华语新闻。

sentences.english: It is indicated that it is an interested problem on the use of polyester bottle in packing beer.
sentences.chinese: 指出研制灌装啤酒用聚酯瓶是近年的一个热门课题。

sentences.english: Now she is named as the Top Ten Star of 2010 by Top Hits.
sentences.chinese: 现在，她被命名为2010年十大明星的热门点击。

sentences.english: That allowed us to stock many more copies of hot titles and to advertise their availability.
sentences.chinese: 这使得我们能够拥有更多的热门拷贝，并且广而告之。

sentences.english: End of Nanjing has a team vs. Chongchao popular Chengdu Sheffield United.
sentences.chinese: 下场南京有有队将主场迎战冲超热门的成都谢菲联队。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: The popular comedy is the odds-on favorite to win the top film award this year.
sentences.chinese: 这部流行喜剧是赢取本年电影最高奖项的大热门。

sentences.english: In recent years the researches on the outsourcing business of book-acquisition and cataloguing have become a subject of great interest in China.
sentences.chinese: 近年来我国图书馆业务外包研究成为热门话题。

sentences.english: With so many island paradises to visit, it's no wonder the area is so popular.
sentences.chinese: 这区有许多岛屿渡假天堂可供游访，难怪如此热门。

sentences.english: Ours is a well-known store and our goods are always dependable.
sentences.chinese: 这只手镯是敝店热门货之一。

sentences.english: Nowadays, psychometrics has already been a hot issue in psychological research.
sentences.chinese: 心理测量学目前已成为心理学研究中的一个热门课题。

sentences.english: Once the project is completed, they are off to the next hot opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 项目一旦完成，他们就散伙去抓下一个热门的机会。

sentences.english: The volcano mudpack was popular previously,and it can cure the skin diseases.
sentences.chinese: 以前火山泥浴一直很热门，说是可以治疗皮肤病。

sentences.english: Way too often what is hot this year won't be hot a few years from now.
sentences.chinese: 今年热门的行业几年后很可能会成冷门，这是常事。

sentences.english: As the hottest writing style, news review has a great influence on the current society.
sentences.chinese: 时评是当今中国最热门的文体，对当代社会影响甚大。

sentences.english: Hannah was asked her opinion of a popular play.
sentences.chinese: 他向汉娜征求她对一部热门戏剧的意见。

sentences.english: The lawsuit of the public benefit is becoming a brand-new hot topic in both jurisdiction and law.
sentences.chinese: 公益诉讼是当前司法界和法学界一个崭新的热门话题。

definition: a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
first choice/premium/to come first in the imperial examinations
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
the last few years/last several years/recent years
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
